summary: This document is a chain of FBI emails from July 2, 2020, regarding the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in New Hampshire. It details the charges against her, her location in custody, and includes a request from the British Consulate for consular access. The emails are forwarded between FBI agents in New York and New Hampshire.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She was arrested on July 2, 2020, pursuant to a federal warrant from the SDNY, indicted on June 29, 2020, on six counts including conspiracy to entice a minor, enticement, transportation, and perjury. She is being held in Merrimack County, New Hampshire.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.role: FBI Special Agent, point of contact
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad, is listed as the point of contact for the Maxwell arrest case.

persons.name: FBI Supervisory Special Agent
persons.context: An FBI Supervisory Special Agent from the Bedford, New Hampshire Resident Agency is involved in the email chain regarding Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Resident Agent in Charge
persons.context: The Resident Agent in Charge of the Portsmouth Resident Office forwards a request from the British Consulate to the investigating agent.

persons.name: Vice Consul
persons.context: A Vice Consul from the British Consulate-General in Cambridge, MA, sends an email requesting information on Maxwell's detention and seeking to provide consular assistance.

connections.description: The Special Agent is the FBI point of contact for the investigation and arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell.
The British Vice Consul is attempting to provide consular assistance to Maxwell, a British national, following her arrest.

events.title: Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on a six-count federal indictment by the SDNY.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in New Hampshire pursuant to a federal arrest warrant issued by the SDNY.

events.title: British Consulate Inquiry
events.description: The British Consulate-General contacted the FBI to inquire about Maxwell's detention and request consular access.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, in New Hampshire on a federal warrant from the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
She was indicted on June 29, 2020, on six counts including conspiracy to entice a minor, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury.
At the time of the email, she was being held by the U.S. Marshals in Merrimack County, New Hampshire, pending her initial court appearance.
The British Consulate-General was seeking to provide consular assistance to Maxwell, a British national, but had not received formal notification from the FBI.
The email chain shows coordination between FBI field offices in New York and New Hampshire regarding the arrest and consular inquiry.
